format: A data frame with 5914 observations on the following 14 variables.

parameters.addchoice: an additive scale of the abortion scores
parameters.lchoice: a continuous latent scale of pro-choice scores (from a simple graded response model)
parameters.fin: oppose/"NFNO"/favor abortion if having child would impose financial hardship
parameters.knowspeaker: was the respondent able to correctly identify  the Speaker of the House (John Boehner)
parameters.choice: oppose/"NFNO"/favor abortion if woman chooses to have one
parameters.incest: oppose/"NFNO"/favor abortion if pregnancy was caused by incest
parameters.health: oppose/"NFNO"/favor abortion if pregnancy would hurt woman
parameters.fatal: oppose/"NFNO"/favor abortion if pregnancy would cause woman to die
parameters.rape: oppose/"NFNO"/favor abortion if pregnancy was caused by rape
parameters.sex: oppose/"NFNO"/favor abortion if the child will not be the sex the woman wants
parameters.bd: oppose/"NFNO"/favor abortion if fetus would be born with serious birth defect

description:
Description
A simple data set for in-class illustration about how to estimate and interpret
interactive relationships. The data here are deliberately minimal for that end.
title: Abortion Attitudes (ANES, 2012)
reference:
"NFNO" = "Neither Favor Nor Oppose". All abortion prompts are on a 0-2 scale
where 0 is oppose, 1 is "NFNO", and 2 is favor. The respondent's party
identification is on a similar scale where 0 = "Democrat", 1 = "Independent",
and 2 = "Republican". The additive scale of abortion scores has a minimum
of 0 and a maximum of 16.
